answers.question: What is asylum?
answers.answer: Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania. This applies to individuals who fear persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.question: How can someone apply for asylum?
answers.answer: Someone can apply for asylum either in writing or verbally. Applications can be made directly at a border crossing point or anywhere in Romania if they entered as a migrant. It is not possible to apply for asylum from outside the territory of Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.question: What happens during the asylum process?
answers.answer: During the asylum process, an asylum seeker receives an application form, submits all available relevant documents, and receives a temporary identity document from the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI). The IGI will then schedule preliminary and secondary interviews to determine a form of protection, conducted with an official and a translator.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.question: When can someone expect a decision on their asylum application?
answers.answer: Asylum applications in Romania are evaluated and resolved by the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI) and are normally processed within one to two months.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.question: How can someone get help or support during the asylum process?
answers.answer: During the asylum process, specifically at the interviews, an applicant may request the participation of a CNRR legal advisor or a UNHCR representative for support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.
